result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation by 12:00 pm on 5/19/22. 
- Count one in 22CF36 - Deferred Judgment of Conviction

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243 in court costs to be paid through DOC for count 2, case 2022CF36.
- $200 DNA Surcharge to be paid through DOC for count 2, case 2022CF36.
- Eligible for expungement if requested in writing by Defendant upon successful completion of probation and DJOC.

- 40 Hours of community service
- Absolute sobriety
- Subject to random and regular testing
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Defendant to provide agent with assessment information to help assist agent with follow up programming, if needed.

Progress Report for DJOC. Filed by ADA Becker. km        to kap
e: DA, Atty Harrelson, DOC; email: Jail, c: New Richmond PD and def via mail. sf
filed by Atty Harrelson. sf

08:28 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Hailey Ruth Huseby appeared. Court notes this was a PLEAS and taken off the calendar due to request filed by Atty Harrelson, however parties are here and Atty Satorius will assist for today.  Off Record discussions at 8:30 AM.   BACK ON at 8:35 AM, appearances as previously noted. Court reviews file.  ADA Becker makes statements and recites joint agreement including DJOC to Ct 1.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- AMENDED Possession of Methamphetamine and Ct 2- AMENDED Possess of Amphetamine in 22CF36.  ADA Becker has filed an amended information.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 & 2 in 22CF36.  Court withholds sentence in favor of DJOC on Ct 1 in 22CF36 for 2 years, Court requests quarterly updates.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 2 in 22CF36

S/W 1 Year Probation 

- Court Costs: $243.00  Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00

- 60 days St. Croix County Jail- STAYED 
- Absolute sobriety
- Subject to testing random and regularly
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- DE to provide Agent with assessment information to help assist Agent with follow up programing if needed
- 40 hours of community service

Court orders DE is eligibe for expungement if requested in writing by DE upon successful completion of probation and DJOC. 

- Sign up for probation before by 12:00 PM 5/19/22

Adjourned at 9:14 AM
for continuance. Filed by Atty Harrelson. arc       Per SRN, OK Def appeared and proceeding with plea/sent; no need to reschedule.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- AMENDED

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

12:59 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Hailey Ruth Huseby appeared.  Set for Pleas. Court reviews file and notes COMPAS assessment was completed.  Atty Harrelson recites joint agreement on Ct 2 and Diversion Agreement on Ct 1.  Court questions Attys.  Attys make statements.  Atty Harrelson reads letter from counselor at Hazelden.  Court at this time does not accept the agreement, ADA Becker to get approval from District Atty and Officer Kastens.  Court will continue the matter and will amend bond.  Adjourned 1:18 PM. bph 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:42 PM  Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Hailey Ruth Huseby appeared. Atty. Harrelson states DE wishes to waive prelim, pending resolution based on waiver. Court advises DE of rights. Court finds DF has voluntarily, intelligently and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty. Harrelson anticipates possible substitution of judge. Court sets ARGN. DE confirms address. Bond continues. Adjourned: 3:47 PM. kma  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on February 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. If Defendant is testing at treatment and signs appropriate releases, testing at JSC is suspended. 

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
